DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare effect two different form vitamin D supplement ( vitamin D3 25-hyrdroxyvitamin D3 [ 25 ( OH ) D3 ] ) vitamin D level blood , marker skeletal immune health . This study design pilot study . A multi-ethnic cohort 48 patient include ( 12 Caucasian , 12 African American , 12 Hispanic/Latino , 12 Asian/Asian American ) . Potential study candidate undergo screen visit medical history take , physical exam perform , dietary questionnaire administer , blood collect . The purpose screening visit identify vitamin D-deficient ( 25-hydroxyvitamin D < 20 ng/ml ) individual candidate vitamin D supplementation . Eligible patient randomly assign receive either vitamin D3 ( 2400 IU/day ) 25 ( OH ) D3 ( 20 mcg/day ) 16 week . After initiate supplementation , study patient return follow-up visit week 4 , 8 , 16 . At visit , blood collect assess vitamin D level blood , well marker skeletal immune function . Participation study therefore involve total 5 visit ( 1 screen visit , 1 randomization visit participant receive study supplement , 3 follow-up visit ) . After data collect , change vitamin D level blood follow supplementation either vitamin D3 versus 25 ( OH ) D3 determine , correlate marker calcium balance immune function . Knowledge gain study may significant impact vitamin D status define , vitamin D repletion administer .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Vitamin D3 Versus 25OHD3 Mineral Metabolism Immune Function
DOC.criteria: Age > 18 25D < 20 mg/ml Age < 18 25D > 20 ng/ml time screen Clear sign infection time screen ( cough , sneeze , wheeze , frequency , dysuria ) History condition would influence intestinal absorption vitamin D3 25OHD3 supplement History nephrolithiasis , primary hyperparathyroidism , metabolic bone disease History chronic kidney disease ( define CrCl < 30 ml/min ) History rheumatologic autoimmune condition History sarcoidosis History active latent tuberculosis History HIV History hyperthyroidism History chronic glucocorticoid use define equivalent 5 mg prednisone per day 2 month within last 6 month History use medication know affect calcium/vitamin D metabolism , bone metabolism , immune response Hypercalcemia Hypercalcinuria
